node.title: January 6 Committee Issues 5 New Subpoenas, Includes Roger Stone and Alex Jones
node.alt: The House committee investigating the January 6 Capitol riot issued five new subpoenas on Monday to allies of former President Donald Trump, including Roger Stone and Alex Jones. Pictured: Pro-Trump supporters storm the U.S. Capitol following a rally with then-President Trump on January 6, 2021, in Washington, D.C.
node.description: Five allies to former President Donald Trump, including political consultant Roger Stone and conspiracy theorist Alex Jones, were issued subpoenas.
node.content:
["The House committee investigating the January 6 riot at the U.S. Capitol issued five new subpoenas on Monday to allies of former President Donald Trump, including Republican political consultant Roger Stone and conspiracy theorist Alex Jones.", "\"The Select Committee is seeking information about the rallies and subsequent march to the Capitol that escalated into a violent mob attacking the Capitol and threatening our democracy. We need to know who organized, planned, paid for, and received funds related to those events, as well as what communications organizers had with officials in the White House and Congress,\" Democratic Representative Bennie Thompson of Mississippi, the committee chair, said in a statement.", "A number of other individuals involved with planning \"Stop the Steal\" rallies were issued subpoenas, including Dustin Stockton, Jennifer Lawrence, and Trump's latest spokesperson, Taylor Budowich, who also serves as the communications director for the Save America PAC.", "The committee also stated that Budowich \"reportedly solicited a 501c(4) organization to conduct a social media and radio advertising campaign encouraging attendance at the January 6th Ellipse rally and advancing unsupported claims about the result of the election.\"", "This is a breaking news story that will be updated.", "", "
The House committee investigating the January 6 Capitol riot issued five new subpoenas on Monday to allies of former President Donald Trump, including Roger Stone and Alex Jones. Pictured: Pro-Trump supporters storm the U.S. Capitol following a rally with then-President Trump on January 6, 2021, in Washington, D.C.
"]
